name: Thin Crust Margherita
method: Put the flour into a large bowl, then stir in the yeast and salt. Make a well, pour in olive oil and warm water  and bring together with a wooden spoon until you have a soft, fairly wet dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 mins until smooth. Cover with a tea towel and set aside
Mix basil crushed garlic and passata,together, then season to taste. Leave to stand at room temperature while you get on with shaping the base
Give the dough a quick knead and than on n a floured surface roll it out into large thin rounds, about 25cm across. Lift the rounds onto greasing paper
Heat oven to 240C/fan 220C /gas 8. Smooth sauce over base. Scatter with Parmesan and Mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 8 - 10 mins until crisp
Serve with a little more olive oil, and basil leaves
